I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

forall p : packet, pDst p = primary -> inc_in_flight_to_backup [p] = 0

Inductive Name : Set := primary : Name | backup : Name
Record packet (P : BaseParams) (params : MultiParams P) : Type := mkPacket { pSrc : name; pDst : name; pBody : msg } Arguments packet {P params} Arguments mkPacket {P params}
inc_in_flight_to_backup = fun l : list packet => length (filterMap (fun p : packet => if msg_eq_dec (pBody p) inc then if name_eq_dec (pDst p) backup then Some tt else None else None) l) : list packet -> nat Arguments inc_in_flight_to_backup _%list_scope
pDst = fun (P : BaseParams) (params : MultiParams P) (p : packet) => let (_, pDst, _) := p in pDst : forall (P : BaseParams) (params : MultiParams P), packet -> name Arguments pDst {P params}
packet_eta : forall p : packet, {| pSrc := pSrc p; pDst := pDst p; pBody := pBody p |} = p
inc_in_flight_to_backup_app : forall xs ys : list packet, inc_in_flight_to_backup (xs ++ ys) = inc_in_flight_to_backup xs + inc_in_flight_to_backup ys
packet_eq_dec : forall p q : packet, {p = q} + {p <> q}
StepDup_dup : forall (net net' : network) (p : packet) (xs ys : list packet), nwPackets net = xs ++ p :: ys -> net' = {| nwPackets := p :: xs ++ p :: ys; nwState := nwState net |} -> step_dup net net' []

NoDup_Nodes = NoDup_cons primary (fun H : backup = primary \/ False => or_ind (fun H0 : backup = primary => let H1 : False := eq_ind backup (fun e : Name => match e with | primary => False | backup => True end) I primary H0 in False_ind False H1) (fun H0 : False => False_ind False H0) H) (NoDup_cons backup (fun H : False => False_ind False H) (NoDup_nil Name)) : NoDup Nodes

Name_rec : forall P : Name -> Set, P primary -> P backup -> forall n : Name, P n
Name_sind : forall P : Name -> SProp, P primary -> P backup -> forall n : Name, P n
